_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Vegetable (except Potato) and Melon Farming

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of A. Duda & Sons, Inc., is a located in Belle Glade, Florida.  The facility utilizes anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant to maintain the proper temperature for storing of product until distribution.  Anhydrous ammonia is an effective refrigerant that has been used for many years by most food processing facilities.  Ammonia is normally a gas at ambient temperatures but is handled as a gas liquefied under pressure.  The refrigeration system consists of pressure vessels, evaporators, compressors, piping and other refrigeration equipment.

Accidental Release Prevention and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:   Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc. is committed to promoting safety for the plant, its employees and the surrounding area.  The facility is complying with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard, Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations 1910.110 and EPA's Risk Management Program Title 40 CFR Part 68.  The purpose of these programs is to ensure that the refrigeration system is operated safely in order to prevent releases of ammonia from the system.  In addition, these programs serve to develop procedures to minimize releases in the event that they do occur and to outline appropriate emergency action steps to take in the event of a release.

Worst Case Release Scenario:  EPA's "General Guidance for Risk Management Programs" and the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration's Risk Management Guidelines were the primary documents used to develop the worst case release scenario.  The worst case release is one that is unlikely to occur.  The purpose of the worst care release analysis is to support a dialogue with the community on release prevention.  It is a conservative analysis and is not to serve as a rational basis for the actual emergency response planning.

Documentation of the worst case release scenario for the refrigeration system is located at the facility.  

Alternative Case Release Scenario:  The alternat

ive release scenario is one that is more likely to occur than the worst case release scenario.  The alternative release scenario must meet two criteria: 1) Must be more likely to occur that the worst case scenario and; 2) Must reach an endpoint off site, unless no such criteria exist.  

Documentation of the alternative release scenario for the refrigeration system is located at the facility.  

Accidental Release Prevention Program:  As a part of the PSM program, Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc. has established numerous programs that serve to prevent accidental releases of ammonia.  There programs include:
Process Safety Information
Process Hazard Analysis
Operating Procedures
Training
Mechanical Integrity
Management of Change
Pre Startup Safety Review
Compliance Audits
Incident Investigation
Employee Participation
Emergency Planning and Response
Hot Work Permits
Contractor Safety

Emergency Response Information:  As a part of the PSM Program, Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc. maintains an Emergency Action Plan that was prepared in order to improve responsiveness to an emergency incident, and to increase the reliability of actions taken during an incident.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency action and evacuation including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, and notification of local emergency response agencies.  In the event of an emergency involving the ammonia system, it is the policy of the facility to respond in a defensive manner as well as request assistance as necessary by calling the local fire department and hazmat team.

Training:  Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc. conducts general awareness training for all employees.  Equipment operators are provided with on the job training followed up with testing and observation to demonstrate understanding.  Additionally, mechanics responsible for maintaining the ammonia system complete refresher training and certification every three years at Lanier Technical College in Georgia. 

Five-Year Accident Hist

ory:  Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc. continues its excellent record of preventing accidental releases.

Steps to Improve Safety:  Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc. is taking a hands-on approach to ensuring the safety of their employees and community.  Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc. will operate and maintain the system in accordance with IIAR Guidance and will continue to implement its OSHA PSM Program in conjunction with the Risk Management Program.
